SEinte Katerine of noble kunne &punctelev; cam bi olde dawe
Hire fader wa&slong; king hire Moder moder
Qu&ydot;ene qu&ydot;ene &punctelev; boþe of þe olde lawe·
Þe king · Co&slong;te · hire fader het &punctelev; gret clerk þis Ma&ydot;de ma&ydot;de wa&slong;
Þare na&slong; non of þe seue·Ars &punctelev; þat heo mai&slong;ter of na&slong;
Maxentius het þe Aum&pbardes;our Aumperour &punctelev; In in eche londe he let crie
Þat ech k&ydot;nerich under him &punctelev; come to Alisaund&rrot;ie

ho&slong;o it lete men &slong;cholde of him don &punctelev; &slong;w&ydot;þe &slong;tronge Iu&slong;tise iustise
Þo ech lond wa&slong; þudere icome &punctelev; to don heo&rrot;e lawe
¶Seinte kat&combtildevert;ine Katerine wel harde
¶liche &punctelev; toward heom
¶gan d&rrot;awe This verse has been added on several lines between the main text and the pricking. The text wraps when it reaches the pricking with each new line preceded by a pilcrow to separate the added text from the main text. I have used pc to ensure that the pilcrows do not render in the critical view, but it may be worth devising some less ad hoc system for handling these circumstances.
bi halue&slong; heo &slong;tod and biheold &punctelev; heo&rrot;e wrechche g&ydot;dihede
heo &slong;aiȝ Anouri anouri þe Maumate&slong; &punctelev; and manie c&combtildevert;&slong;tine Cristine cri&slong;tine Men men fo&rrot; d&rrot;ede
Þo hadde heo gret deol in hire heo&rrot;te &punctelev; and ble&slong;&slong;e blessesde hire anon
And fo&rrot;th anon to þe Aum&pbardes;our Aumperour &punctelev; baldeliche heo gan gon
Sire heo &slong;seide riche Aum&pbardes;our Aumperour þou art &punctelev; &slong;wiþe noble and hende
Þov &slong;cholde&slong;t þi wi&slong;dom and þi wit &punctelev; to &slong;ome guode wende
Þat i I &slong;egge fo&rrot; þe folie &punctelev; þat ich i&slong;eo eov do
So muche feo&rrot;rene folk &punctelev; þov ha&slong;t icleopet þarto
Grete Ioie ioie in ouwer heo&rrot;te &punctelev; þis temple ȝe makiez ifo
Þat is &ydot;maud of l&ydot;m and &slong;ton &punctelev; and of ouwer Maumate&slong; al&slong;o
Ȝw&ydot; ne biholde ȝe þe heiȝe temple &punctelev; fo&rrot; þerof wond&rrot;i ov mai
Of þe heie heuene þat geth aboute &punctelev; abouen eov niȝt and dai
Of sonne and Mone mone and &slong;teo&rrot;rene al&slong;o &punctelev; fram þe e&slong;te to þe we&slong;te
Þat trauaillieth and neuere werie ne beoth &punctelev; ne neuere ne habbeth re&slong;te
biþench þe wel and turne þi wit &punctelev; to &slong;ome wi&slong;dome ich rede
And ȝwane þin owene Inwit inwit it &slong;eith &punctelev; þat nouȝwere nis &slong;wuch dede
Almiȝti god God þou him hold &punctelev; þat &slong;wuch wonder can make
bifo&rrot;e alle oþere Anoure anoure him &punctelev; and þine Maumate&slong; fo&rrot;&slong;ake

Gret wonder him þouȝte of hire fairhede &punctelev; and of hire Quo&ydot;nti&slong;e quo&ydot;ntise
Ma&ydot;de he &slong;eide abijd herewith &punctelev; fo&rrot;to aftur o&rrot;e &slong;acrefi&slong;e
And we &slong;chullen mo&rrot;e with þe &slong;peke &punctelev; ich oþur mi Iu&slong;ti&slong;e iustise
Þo þe &slong;acrefi&slong;e wa&slong; idon &punctelev; þe Aum&pbardes;our Aumperour &slong;at In in is trone
And al is folk abouten him. &punctelev; men b&rrot;outen þat Maide maide &slong;one
Maide &slong;eide þe Aum&pbardes;ur Aumperur &punctelev; þou þinche&slong;t gent and freo
Of ȝwat kunrade art þou icome &punctelev; gret wonder u&slong; þinchez of þe
¶Sire Aum&pbardes;ur Aumperur þis Maide maide &slong;eide &punctelev; I ne wilni bote lu&ydot;te
to tellen þe of mine kunne &punctelev; fo&rrot; it were &slong;igne of p&rrot;u&ydot;te
Fo&rrot; In in is boke þe wi&slong;e Man man &punctelev; Catun &slong;eith al&slong;o
Þat Man man ne &slong;chal him&slong;ulue p&rrot;ei&slong;i &punctelev; ne blamie no þe mo
Fo&rrot; &slong;o doth fole&slong; þat wilniez muche &punctelev; of ȝelpingue and of &slong;unne
Naþele&slong; ichulle ake fo&rrot; no p&rrot;u&ydot;te &punctelev; tellen eov of mine kunne
Ich am þe kingu&slong; douȝter co&slong;te Coste &punctelev; þat þou wo&slong;t ȝwuch is
hi⁁dere ich cam to &slong;peke mid eov &punctelev; of þat ȝe bileuez amis·de

And we &slong;chulle betere ileue alle men &punctelev; and mo&rrot;e it wole beo note
Þane ani fol womman a&slong;e þou art &punctelev; fo&rrot; ouwer bolt is &slong;one i&slong;chote
Sire &slong;eide þis Maide maide þo &punctelev; þei þou lu&ydot;te telle of me
Al&slong;o guod mai beo mi re&slong;on &punctelev; a&slong;e þat comez of þe
Fo&rrot; &slong;ire Aumperur ich þou art &punctelev; a&slong;e ech man is al&slong;o
Þat hote mai and h&ydot;s men moten &punctelev; nede h&ydot;s he&slong;te&slong; do
Of bodi and of &slong;oule þou art &ydot;maud &punctelev; a&slong;e þi&slong;ulf miȝt i&slong;eo
Mid riȝte þi &slong;oule Mai&slong;ter mai&slong;ter is &punctelev; and þi bodi is h&ydot;ne &slong;chal beo

Aȝen ku&ydot;nde it is &punctelev; and þou wo&rrot;&slong;t &slong;ikur &punctelev; þarefo&rrot;e of helle pine
Þo&rrot;uȝ hire clergie þat holi Maide maide &punctelev; re&slong;one&slong; made &slong;o quo&ydot;nte
Þat þe Aum&pbardes;our Aumperour ne non of his &punctelev; ne couþe hire an&slong;uerie in none pointe

Al&slong;o wide a&slong;e men miȝten &slong;eche &punctelev; ouȝwere In in ani lond

Fo&rrot;to de&slong;puti aȝein a ȝong womman &punctelev; þat al heo&rrot;e lawe &slong;chende

¶An Aungel aungel to þis maide cam &punctelev; and bad hire of noþing d&rrot;ede

Sire he heo &slong;eide to þe Aum&pbardes;ur Aumperur &punctelev; ȝif&slong;t þou a wi&slong;dom
Þat þu&slong; fale mai&slong;tres of clergie &punctelev; bringe&slong;t and &slong;e&slong;t a benche

¶Nov ichulle fo&rrot; god God is min help &punctelev; afonge þat me wole falle

Þenche&slong;tþou &slong;peke aȝein o&rrot;e clergie &punctelev; turne þi þouȝt ich rede
Þov &slong;ei&slong;t þat god God almiȝti &punctelev; dethz on eo&rrot;þe þolede here
Ichulle &pflour;oui proui þat he ne miȝte aliue beo &punctelev; nouþe In in none manere
Fo&rrot; hoso deiez he ne ma&ydot; &punctelev; neuerefft to liue come
Ȝwane þe v&combtildevert;tue vertue of al is bodi &punctelev; þo&rrot;u deþe him is binome
And þi god God almiȝti is ded &punctelev; þou ne miȝt libbe nouȝt
Ȝif he þat &slong;cholde ȝiue þe lijf &punctelev; is to deþe ib&rrot;ouȝt
¶Nai &slong;eide þis holi ma&ydot;de &punctelev; þou faille&slong;t of þin art
Anoþur þou mo&slong;t segge ȝif þou þenc&slong;t &punctelev; of þine mai&slong;t&combtildevert;e maistrie to habbe part
God hadde euere and euere he &slong;chal &punctelev; mid him is godhede
And fo&rrot; loue of u&slong; In in o&rrot;e fle&slong;che &punctelev; he nam him manhede
Of twei þingus he wa&slong; þo imaked &punctelev; eiþur mo&slong;te þo i&slong; ku&ydot;nde afonge
Fo&rrot; þe kunde of manhede u&slong; to bugge &punctelev; he þolede deth wel &slong;tronge
Ake fo&rrot;to bileue ded aȝen ku&ydot;nde it wa&slong; &punctelev; a&slong;e of is godhede
Þarefo&rrot;e he aro&slong; fram deþe to liue &punctelev; þo he hadde idon al is dede
Fo&rrot; þe &slong;tronge deþe þat þo&rrot;uȝ Adam &punctelev; we weren to ib&rrot;ouȝt
Þo&rrot;uȝ i&slong; godhede ime&ydot;nd In in o&rrot;e ku&ydot;nde &punctelev; nede mo&slong;te beon ibouȝt
Ȝif þou with&slong;ei&slong;t þis re&slong;on &punctelev; an oþur ichulle þe make
Þat grete clerke&slong; &slong;eiden In in heo&rrot;e lawe &punctelev; þat man ne ma&ydot; nouȝt fo&rrot;&slong;ake

And hu&ydot; afenge þe deth fo&rrot; gode&slong; Godes loue &punctelev; withoute anie mone

of heuȝ &punctelev; þane heo euere er were
Þare na&slong; &slong;o lu&ydot;te wem on heom &punctelev; þat þe le&slong;te of heo&rrot;e here
Oþur of heo&rrot;e cloþus apeirede weren &punctelev; heo leien with faire chere

katerine Katerine
haue reuþe of þi&slong;ulf he &slong;eide &punctelev; and &slong;child þe fram pine
haue reuþe of þi noble bodi &punctelev; þat is &slong;o fair and hende
Fo&rrot; þou &slong;chalt beon in grete noble&ydot;e &punctelev; ȝif þou wolt þi þouȝt wende
In mi paleis ich &slong;chal þe make &punctelev; hext after þe quene
After þi fourme ichulle þe make &punctelev; An &ydot;mage b&rrot;iȝt and &slong;chene
Ouer guld and quo&ydot;nte inov &punctelev; and &slong;ette a&slong; amidde þe cite
Þat ech man hire honouri &slong;chal &punctelev; fo&rrot; honour of þe
A&slong;e men &slong;chullen to one god do &punctelev; þou ne &slong;chalt mid al þi lo&rrot;e
So muche nobleie biþenche þe &punctelev; þat I nelle don þe mo&rrot;e
¶Sire Aum&pbardes;ur Aumperur þi&slong; Maide maide &slong;eide &punctelev; let þi fole þouȝt
Fo&rrot; þov na&slong;t non mo&rrot;e ȝwile to &slong;pille &punctelev; þane &slong;peken e⁁mbe nouȝt
god almiȝtie&slong; &slong;pou&slong;e ich am &punctelev; and al þi blaundi&slong;inge
Ne alle þine to&rrot;menz ne &slong;chullen min heo&rrot;te &punctelev; ene&slong; fram him b&rrot;inge
Þe Aum&pbardes;ur Aumperur hire let &slong;trep strepe naked &punctelev; and to a piler fa&slong;te hire bounden
With &slong;tronge &slong;chourge&slong; men beoten hire &slong;o&rrot;e &punctelev; and maden hire harde wounden
Þo heo ne miȝten þarewithal &punctelev; turnen hire þouȝt
In depe p&rrot;i&slong;one and &slong;wiþe deo&rrot;ke &punctelev; &slong;one heo wa&slong; ib&rrot;ouȝt
